note.p: Birth: Stoke Newington, London, England (07 February 1824)

Career: In business; gave up business in favour of astronomy; built an observatory at Tulse Hill; devised the star spectroscope with William Allen Miller (FRS 1845); received Civil List pension of Â£150 (1890); President, British Association (1891); died after a surgical operation; was cremated and his ashes buried at Golders Green.
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1866; Rumford Medal 1880; Copley Medal 1898
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1911-1912 vol 86 pp i-xix, plate, signed by F W D
References: Joan Mason, 'Hertha Ayrton (1854-1923) and the Admission of Women to the Royal Society of London' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 201-220
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
F Kurzer, 'The life and work of Charles Tomlinson FRS: A Career in Victorian Science and Technology' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 203-226
